info.title: Google Sheets SDK API
info.description: Single entry-point API for all Google Sheets SDK functions via a wrapper Lambda

post.summary: Validates and refreshes an access token if necessary.
post.description: This function checks if the current access token is valid. If the token is not valid, it attempts to refresh the token using the refresh token. The function is useful for maintaining an active session and ensuring API requests have valid authentication.

body.description: Body of the validateAccessToken sls call

isValid.description: Indicates whether the access token is valid

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Refreshes the access token using the refresh token.
post.description: This function uses the refresh token to obtain a new access token. It returns a promise that resolves when the access token has been successfully refreshed. The function does not require any parameters and is typically used to maintain an active session without requiring the user to log in again.

body.description: Body of the refreshAccessToken sls call

post.summary: Retrieves values from a specified range in a Google Sheet.
post.description: The getValues function fetches data from a given range in a Google Sheet. It takes a Range object as input, which includes the sheet ID and the A1 notation of the desired range. The function returns a promise that resolves to a two-dimensional array containing the values from the specified range, or an empty array if the range is empty.

body.description: Body of the getValues sls call

items.description: Range object specifying the sheet ID and range

range.description: The A1 notation of the range

schema.description: A two-dimensional array containing the values in the specified range

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message describing the internal server error

post.summary: Updates values in a specified range of a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function updates the values in a specified range of a Google Sheet with the provided data. It takes an input object containing the range and values to update, along with an optional parameter to specify how the input data should be interpreted. The function returns a promise that resolves to an object containing information about the update operation.

body.description: Body of the updateValues sls call

items.description: UpdateValuesInput - An object containing the range and values to update

range.description: The A1 notation of the range

values.description: The values to be updated. Should be a two-dimensional array

items.description: How the input data should be interpreted

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message describing the server-side issue

post.summary: Appends values to a specified range in a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function appends provided data to a specified range in a Google Sheet. It allows customization of how the input data should be interpreted and inserted. The function returns a promise that resolves to an object containing information about the append operation.

body.description: Body of the appendValues sls call

items.description: AppendValuesInput object containing the range and values to append

range.description: The A1 notation of the range

values.description: The values to be appended (two-dimensional array)

items.description: How the input data should be interpreted
How the input data should be inserted

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet that was modified

tableRange.description: The range that was appended to

spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet that was modified

updatedRange.description: The range that was appended to

updatedRows.description: The number of rows that were appended

updatedColumns.description: The number of columns that were appended

updatedCells.description: The number of cells that were appended

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Clears values from a specified range in a Google Sheet.
post.description: The clearValues function removes all values from a designated range within a Google Sheet. It takes a single input object containing the sheet ID and the A1 notation of the range to be cleared. The function returns a promise that resolves to an object with information about the clear operation.

body.description: Body of the clearValues sls call

items.description: ClearValuesInput - An object specifying the sheet ID and range

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet. This is a required field and should be a valid string.

range.description: The A1 notation of the range. This is a required field and should be a valid string.

updatedCells.description: The number of cells that were cleared

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message describing the server-side issue

post.summary: Batch retrieves values from multiple ranges in a Google Sheet.
post.description: The batchGetValues function allows for efficient retrieval of data from multiple ranges within a Google Sheet using a single API call. It takes a sheet ID and an array of range notations as input, returning a three-dimensional array containing the values from the specified ranges. This function is particularly useful for retrieving data from non-contiguous ranges or multiple worksheets within the same spreadsheet.

body.description: Body of the batchGetValues sls call

items.description: An array of A1 notations of the ranges to retrieve

schema.description: A three-dimensional array containing the values in the specified ranges

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message indicating a server-side issue

post.summary: Batch updates values in multiple ranges of a Google Sheet.
post.description: The batchUpdateValues function updates the values in multiple specified ranges of a Google Sheet with the provided data in a single batch request. It allows for efficient updating of multiple ranges within a sheet, reducing the number of API calls required for multiple updates.

body.description: Body of the batchUpdateValues sls call

items.description: The ID of the sheet. This is a required field and should be a valid string.
An array of objects, each containing the range and values to update. This is a required field.
How the input data should be interpreted. Possible values: 'USER_ENTERED', 'RAW', 'INPUT_VALUE_OPTION_UNSPECIFIED'. Defaults to 'USER_ENTERED'.

post.summary: Batch clears values from multiple ranges in a Google Sheet.
post.description: This function clears all values from multiple specified ranges in a Google Sheet using a single batch request. It takes a sheet ID and an array of range notations as input, and returns a promise that resolves to an object containing information about the clear operation.

body.description: Body of the batchClearValues sls call

items.description: An array of A1 notations of the ranges to clear

error.description: Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Detects fully duplicated rows within a specified sheet range.
post.description: This function analyzes a given range in a sheet to identify and return fully duplicated rows. It takes a single configuration object parameter specifying the sheet ID and the range to check, and returns a Promise that resolves to an array of duplicate rows found within that range.

body.description: Body of the duplicateRowsDetection sls call

items.description: Configuration object containing the range to check for duplicates

sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet containing the range to check

range.description: The range to check for duplicates (e.g. 'A1:B10')

schema.description: An array of duplicate rows detected in the specified range

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message describing the internal server error

post.summary: Sanitizes sheet data by removing whitespace padding from string cells in a given range and updates the sheet.
post.description: The sanitizeSheetData function cleans up data in a specified range of a Google Sheet by trimming whitespace from string values. It takes an input object containing the range and values to be cleaned, processes the data to remove leading and trailing spaces, and then updates the sheet with the sanitized values. This function is useful for standardizing data format and improving data quality in spreadsheets.

body.description: Body of the sanitizeSheetData sls call

items.description: UpdateValuesInput object containing the range and values to clean and update

range.description: The range to update in the sheet
The A1 notation of the range

values.description: The values to update in the specified range

200.description: Successfully sanitized and updated sheet data

schema.description: Update result from Google Sheets API

updatedRows.description: The number of rows that were updated

updatedColumns.description: The number of columns that were updated

updatedCells.description: The number of cells that were updated

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message describing the internal server error
